Discover hiking trails near you with HikeMate's powerful search features:

1. Using the Map
• Open the map view to see trails in your area
• Pan and zoom to explore different regions
• Use the search button to find trails in the visible area

2. Understanding Trail Cards
• View distance, elevation gain, and difficulty
• See elevation profiles for each trail
• Check estimated completion times

3. Smart Features
• Filter trails by difficulty level
• See which trails match your hiking level
• Get terrain and trail condition information

Pro Tip: Use the location button to find trails near your current position!

Keep track of your favorite trails and plan future hikes:

1. Saving Trails
• Tap the bookmark icon on any trail to save it
• Access all saved trails from the Saved tab
• Organize trails by planned dates

2. Planning Features
• Add planned dates to saved trails
• Set reminders for upcoming hikes
• View your hiking calendar

3. Managing Saved Trails
• View saved trails offline
• Remove trails you've completed
• Track your hiking history

Pro Tip: Use the planning feature to organize multiple hikes and create a hiking schedule!

Understanding trail difficulty is key to a safe and enjoyable hiking experience. HikeMate uses three main difficulty levels:

🟢 Beginner Trails
• Distance: Less than 3km
• Elevation gain: Under 250m
• Usually well-maintained paths
• Clear markers and signage

🟡 Intermediate Trails
• Distance: 3-6km
• Elevation gain: 250-500m
• Some challenging sections
• Basic navigation skills needed

🔴 Expert Trails
• Distance: Over 6km
• Elevation gain: Over 500m
• Challenging terrain
• Advanced navigation required

Remember: Start with easier trails and gradually work your way up as you gain experience. HikeMate will help you track your progress!

Essential gear ensures a safe and comfortable hiking experience:

1. Must-Have Basics:
• Hiking boots or sturdy shoes
• Weather-appropriate clothing
• Water and snacks
• Basic first aid kit
• Phone with HikeMate app

2. Weather Protection:
• Rain jacket
• Sun protection
• Extra layers

3. Safety Items:
• Basic first aid
• Emergency contacts
• Power bank

Pro Tip: Always check trail conditions and weather before heading out!

Proper weather preparation is essential:

1. Before Your Hike:
• Check the forecast
• Review trail conditions
• Pack appropriate gear

2. During Different Weather:
• Hot weather: Stay hydrated, sun protection
• Cold weather: Layer clothing, extra warmth
• Rain: Waterproof gear, good footwear

3. Safety Tips:
• Start early to avoid storms
• Know when to turn back
• Stay updated with HikeMate

Learn to use HikeMate's planning features:

1. Trail Selection
• Filter by difficulty level
• Check trail conditions
• View elevation profiles

2. Planning Tools
• Save favorite trails
• Set hiking dates
• Get weather alerts

3. Navigation Features
• Download offline maps
• Track your location
• Follow trail markers
Start by opening the map view where you can explore hike routes in your area
Use the search button to find routes in the visible map area
Click on any hike to see its details including distance, elevation, and difficulty
When viewing a hike, tap the bookmark icon to save it for later
Access your saved hikes from the Saved tab
Add a planned date to any saved hike to organize your hiking schedule
